content.title: Award Of Scholarships To Young Artists In Different Cultural Fields
content.details: The scheme 'Award of Scholarships to Young Artists in Different Cultural Fields' was launched by the Ministry of Culture, Government of India. This scheme seeks to give assistance to young artists of outstanding promise for advanced training within India in the field of Indian Classical Music, Indian Classical Dance, Theatre, Mime, Visual art, Folk, Traditional and Indigenous Arts, and Light Classical Music.
benefits: Each scholar will be paid ₹5000/- per month for a period of two years to cover living expenses on travel, books, art material, or other equipment and tuition or training charges.
eligibility: Candidates should have adequate general education to pursue their training effectively.
Candidates must give evidence of their desire to make the pursuit of their training effectively.
Candidates must have already acquired a degree of proficiency in the chosen field.
Candidates should have undergone a minimum of 5 years of training with their Guru/Institutes.
Candidates should have adequate knowledge of the connected arts/ disciplines.
The candidate's age should not be less than 18 years and not more than 25 years as of 1st April of the year in which the application is being made.
content.application_process: Online application process through the CSMS Portal.
documents_required: One self-attested copy of Education Qualifications (Degrees, Diplomas, etc.)
One self-attested copy of the Matriculation or equivalent certificate or other admissible evidence of age.
Self-attested copies of photographs of the Original works for candidates applying in Visual Arts.

faqs.question: What is the 'Award of Scholarships to Young Artists in Different Cultural Fields' scheme?
faqs.answer: Under the scheme, assistance is provided to young artists of outstanding promise for advanced training within India in the field of Indian Classical Music, Indian Classical Dance, Theatre, Mime, Visual art, Folk, Traditional and Indigenous Arts, and Light Classical Music.

faqs.question: Which ministry has started the scheme?
faqs.answer: Ministry of Culture, Government of India.

faqs.question: Is this Central Sector Scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, this is a Central Sector Scheme.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Each scholar will be paid ₹5000/- per month for a period of two years to cover living expenses.

faqs.question: What is the total number of scholarships?
faqs.answer: The total number of scholarships is 400.

faqs.question: What should the minimum educational qualification be required for applying under the scheme?
faqs.answer: A candidate having a degree of proficiency in the concerned field is eligible to apply.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: A candidate of Indian Nationals who has adequate general education to pursue their training effectively is eligible.

faqs.question: What is the age criterion for an applicant to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The candidate's age should not be less than 18 years and not more than 25 years.

faqs.question: Is there any training experience required to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the candidate should have undergone a minimum of 5 years of training with their Guru/Institutes.

faqs.question: How can an applicant apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicant may apply through online mode on the CSMS Portal.
